TITLE: U.S.-China global influence battle takes center stage at COP27
SUMMARY: Biden and Xi will offer competing initiatives for developing world support.

TITLE: Climate conference opens with calls to share the financial burden
SUMMARY: The summit began with a breakthrough after countries agreed for the first time in the history of these talks to discuss compensation arrangements for irreparable climate damages.

TITLE: Biden to press human rights in meeting with Egyptian president
SUMMARY: The U.S. has "raised repeated concerns" about a jailed activist.

TITLE: Kerry pitches climate finance plan. Other countries say it’s ‘not enough’
SUMMARY: Under the proposal from the U.S. climate envoy, companies would buy carbon credits that fund the greening of power grids in developing countries. It comes as rich nations face pressure at COP 27 to make good on their promise to mobilize $100 billion a year in climate finance for poorer nations.

TITLE: U.N. agency: Iran continues to block nuclear probe, scales up its nuclear program
SUMMARY: Diplomats say its ‘likely’ Iran could face a fresh resolution at the IAEA Board of Governors next week in Vienna.

TITLE: Watch: Tropical Storm Nicole makes landfall in Florida
Kerry pitches climate finance plan. Other countries say it’s ‘not enough.’
SUMMARY: Under the proposal from the U.S. climate envoy, companies would buy carbon credits that fund the greening of power grids in developing countries. It comes as rich nations face pressure at COP 27 to make good on their promise to mobilize $100 billion a year in climate finance for poorer nations.

TITLE: Biden's mission at climate summit: Convince world 'it’s different now'
SUMMARY: Delegates at COP27 were divided on whether the U.S. president's three-hour visit met the mark.

TITLE: Biden pledges 500M with EU, Germany for clean energy in Egypt
Biden touts ‘unprecedented’ U.S. actions at Egypt climate summit
SUMMARY: “We’re proving a good climate policy is a good economic policy,” the president said to applause. But developing nations ask: Where’s the money?

TITLE: Ukraine tells allies it may not be able to recover from more Russian attacks on energy systems
SUMMARY: Ukrainian officials are asking the U.S. and Europe for parts to fix its electric grid and gas systems.

TITLE: U.S. eyes shifts on climate payments, in possible breakthrough at summit
SUMMARY: New text circulating at the U.N. climate talks in Egypt suggests that Washington is reconsidering its resistance to supplying developing countries with funds for the damage they suffer from rising temperatures.

TITLE: John Kerry comes down with Covid at climate summit
SUMMARY: The special envoy's test results come as the U.N. talks run into overtime amid clashing positions from the United States and other countries.

TITLE: Climate talks grow tense as U.S. resists Europe's plan for aid
SUMMARY: The U.S. has not backed a surprise plan from the EU that would open the door for rich nations to pay climate-vulnerable countries for damages they are suffering from the warming planet.

TITLE: Summit yields ‘historic win’ for climate payments, but also a push for natural gas
SUMMARY: Surprise text in the final deal deflated the sense of triumph at the talks in Egypt, where the U.S. and EU had agreed for the first time to create a fund to pay for some countries' climate losses.

TITLE: Nations reach preliminary deal on payments as climate talks grind through overtime
SUMMARY: The issue of paying vulnerable countries for their climate losses has divided the U.S., European Union and China during the U.N. negotiations in Egypt.

TITLE: Summit yields ‘historic win’ for climate payments
SUMMARY: But surprise text in the final deal deflated the sense of triumph at the talks in Egypt by including a push for natural gas.

TITLE: Biden gives Chevron permit to restart Venezuelan oil sales
SUMMARY: The move could help ease global oil prices and speed the declines in U.S. gasoline prices.
